gameplay

Class World

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameplay.World
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class World
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The world class acts as the game board, it manages interactions between gameactors and gameobject instances.
    Author:
    mfong8
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • addGameObject

        public void addGameObject(GameObject gameObject)
        takes in a gameobject and places it on the grid at the location specified by the object itself.
        Parameters:
        gameObject - object that is to be added to the game world.

      • removeGameObject

        public void removeGameObject(GameObject obj)
        remove the specified gameobject from the world. Object specified must be the specific instance that is to be removed and not an equivalent one.
        Parameters:
        obj - the game object that is to be add to the game world.

      • isIntersection

        public boolean isIntersection(java.awt.Rectangle location)
        Parameters:
        location - rectangle representing a location on the game grid
        Returns:
        returns true if the rectangle is at an intersection of walls, returns false if it's not at an intersection of walls

      • detonateLocation

        public void detonateLocation(java.awt.Rectangle location,
                    int radius)
        Detonates the space specified by location, and causes explosions to appear in the four directions within the given radius. Explosions propegate until they hit a solid brick whic is not permeable to explosions such as a brick or wall piece.
        Parameters:
        location - loaction on the grid that is to be blown up
        radius - radius of the explosion

      • checkForCollision

        public boolean checkForCollision(GameObject object)
        checks if the given GameObject object has collided with any other GameObject on the board
        Parameters:
        object - GameObject that is being checked if has collided with something.
        Returns:
        true if the object has collided with another GameObject, false if it has not.

      • willCollide

        public boolean willCollide(GameActor actor,
                  Direction direction)
        Checks a given direction relative to a GameActor to see if the GameActor is able to move onto that space.
        Parameters:
        actor - GameActor that is going to be moving
        direction - direction that in which the actor wants to move
        Returns:
        true if the direction is blocked, false if the direction is free to pass through.

      • getGameObjectInstanceAt

        public GameObject getGameObjectInstanceAt(java.awt.Rectangle location)
        Returns the instance of GameObject as the location specified by location.
        Parameters:
        location - Rectangle representing a location on the grid
        Returns:
        instance of gameObject at that point.
